page.title: 11My gran talks about Wetheral
page.content: I spoke to my gran about Wetheral. The old village of Wetheral was quite small with a triangular green in the middle. The houses were mainly large, built from the local red sandstone and occupied by doctors and lawyers.People wanted to live in this lovely village with its fine old church. My gran's house was built in 1780 and it used to be a public house. When she first came to the village she knew all the people but when the large new housing estates were built the community spirit disappeared.The village grew most quickly in the 1970's and these new houses were bought by people who would work in Carlisle.She says that most houses are owned by the people who live in them and as far as she knows there is no-one out of work in the village.
